basic.description:
A quantitative treatment of chemical phenomena and materials. Critical thinking and problem solving are emphasized. Topics include atomic structure and molecular bonding, organic chemistry, polymers, proteins, and condensed phases.
NOTE    Offered only as a distance course. Consult Continuing and Distance Studies.
NOTE    Not normally intended for on-campus degree plans and certificates.
NOTE    Not appropriate for pre and upper level courses that have a laboratory component.
LEARNING HOURS    126 (54O;72P)
basic.subject: CHEM
basic.title: General Chemistry I: From Atoms to Matter

extra.enrollment_requirement: Exclusion    No more than 6.0 units from CHEM112 or (CHEM113 and CHEM114).
